intro: Limnopoa meeboldii, commonly known as the Meebold's watergrass, is a flowering plant species native to South America. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, commonly referred to as the sedge family. This plant typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and pond margins, where it thrives in moist to aquatic conditions. Limnopoa meeboldii has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences that bloom during the warmer months. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
